notes: unless otherwise indicated in the 'notes', the 'result' is independent of the use of the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plug-in - https://plugins.qgis.org/plugins/gml_application_schema_toolbox/

gml_file_load.notes: gml file is obtained from WFS GetFeature request 'https://wfspoc.brgm-rec.fr:443/geoserver/wfs?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typenames=ef%3AEnvironmentalMonitoringFacility&count=100

gml_WFS2_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema toolbox' plugin

gml_WFS2_display.notes: need to use the 'GML application schema toolbox' plugin

gml_features_edit.notes: Editing is possible only using the 'GML Application schema toolbox' plugin. There is no possibility to save edits in the source gml dataset nor to save edited layer as a new GML dataset preserving the INSPIRE structure. The 'Load in relational mode (GMLAS)' and 'Load from GMLAS database' options allow updating relevant DB tables (SQLite or PostgreSQL).

gml_features_create.notes: Creating new features is allowed if data is loaded by means of the 'GML Application schema toolbox' plugin. However, for the new geometries there is no possibility to edit the '_xml_' field nor to save edited layer as a new GML dataset preserving the INSPIRE structure(in case you use the 'Load in XML mode' option). When using the 'Load in relational mode (GMLAS)' and 'Load from GMLAS database' options, only way to insert the INSPIRE feature properties is to modify each relevant layer (i.e. DB table). This is quite complicated because with INSPIRE schemas you have tens of tables.

gml_size_200m_load.notes: gml data used for this test is Spanish AD data - download link can be found in relevant 'Addresses of Gipuzkoa, INSPIRE' MD available in the INSPIRE Geoportal

gml_geometry_load.notes: also when geometries are 'hidden' in complex data types, such in the case of the AD theme

gml_geometry_display.notes: also when geometries are 'hidden' in complex data types, such in the case of the AD theme

gml_mixed_geometry_load.notes: Only if NOT USING the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin ! - The test case gml file is the result of the WFS GetFeature request http://geoserver.ymparisto.fi/geoserver/wfs?service=WFS&version=2.0.0&request=GetFeature&typenames=ps%3AProtectedSite&count=10

gml_mixed_geometry_display.notes: Only if NOT USING the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin ! - One layer provided for each geometry type

gml_multiple_geometry_load.notes: need to use the GML Application schema plugin. Multiple geometries - e.g. representative points - are uploaded/displayed in a different layer

gml_multiple_geometry_display.notes: need to use the GML Application schema toolbox plugin. Multiple geometries - e.g. representative points - are uploaded/displayed in a different layer

gml_complex_property_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_complex_property_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin.

gml_multiple_occurrences_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin - multiple occurrences in th etest case ef:hasObservation, ef:belongTo

gml_multiple_occurrences_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_xnil_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_xnil_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_nilreason_load.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_nilreason_display.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin

gml_xlinks_resolve.notes: need to use the 'GML Application Schema Toolbox' plugin. Also in this case, however, the internal links (#) are NOT resolved. External links are just opened in the browser, and no possibility to add to the map
